{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3541014,"name":"Jessica Blauwkamp","username":"jessicablauwkamp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/eb8c5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T13:53:12.153Z","cooked":"

We are having a pretty significant connection issue and both of our programming/wiring mentors are out of reach until after competition. We are getting this error code in the Driver’s Station:

Warning 44002 Ping Results: link-bad, DS radio(.4)-bad, robot radio(.1)-GOOD, roboRIO(.2)-bad, FMS-bad Driver Station

We are using an old radio in house because we don’t have a second one to act as an FMS right now, and we had it working last week. Can anyone help me translate what’s wrong and give me a direction to move forward?

Thanks!

The driver station software is able to connect to the radio but is unable to connect to the roboRIO.

Are you able to connect to your roboRIO using a USB cable?

Looks like the roboRIO has been statically set to .10 instead of .2
Navigate to the network settings and change 10.65.61.10 to 10.65.61.2

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

roboRIO Web Dashboard

The roboRIO web dashboard is a webpage built into the roboRIO that can be used for checking status and updating settings of the roboRIO. Opening the WebDash: To open the web dashboard, open a web b...

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-26T15:00:23.264Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":8.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493321,"topic_slug":"robot-connection-issue","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/roborio-info/roborio-web-dashboard.html#network-configuration","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"roboRIO Web Dashboard — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56385,"username":"jessicablauwkamp","name":"Jessica Blauwkamp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/eb8c5e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/robot-connection-issue/493321/12","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3541758,"name":"Jessica Blauwkamp","username":"jessicablauwkamp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/eb8c5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T19:51:44.128Z","cooked":"

This worked!! Thank you so much! Can you explain why it works, just for my own edification?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-26T19:51:44.128Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":34,"readers_count":33,"score":11.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493321,"topic_slug":"robot-connection-issue","display_username":"Jessica Blauwkamp","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":25039,"username":"FletcherS7","name":"Fletcher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56385,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-connection-issue/493321/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3542998,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T22:57:39.583Z","cooked":"

By FIRST convention 10.TE.AM.2 is the reserved IP for the RIO.

If your RIO does not have the team number set correctly (for getting an automatic (DHCP) IP address), it will receive the wrong IP address and things looking to talk to the RIO wont be able to find it.

Likewise if someone sets the static IP to something other than .2 (it wont ask for an address form the DHCP server but rather assert itself as at the set location), it wont be at 10.TE.AM.2 but some other number instead of .2 (in your case .10) - and things looking for the RIO like the driver station wont be able to find it (because all the other devices assume its at .2…but really its at .10).

So setting your RIO to .2 where its supposed to be allows things like the driver station to find it.

For more reading on different IP settings on the robot ethernet network see:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

IP Configurations

TE.AM IP Notation: The notation TE.AM is used as part of IPs in numerous places in this document. This notation refers to splitting your five digit team number into digits for the IP address octets...
